alert.note: Alert for Butler; Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 21 at 11:13PM CDT until June 22 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of South Central and Southeast Kansas, including the following counties, in South Central Kansas, Butler. In Southeast Kansas, Greenwood. * WHEN...Until 945 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Streams will likely to continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1113 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated additional showers and storms may move into the area overnight. Radar estimated between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen Tuesday evening. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area overnight. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Thrall, El Dorado State Park and locations around El Dorado Lake. Locations between Rosalia and Cassoday.
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
